IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CEDA'S MISSION IS TO WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH COMMUNITIES TO EMPOWER FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS TO ACHIEVE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: CEDA IS A COUNTY-WIDE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AGENCY THAT PROVIDES ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND HUMAN SERVICES THAT ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF SUBURBAN COOK COUNTY AND CHICAGO RESIDENTS WORKING IN PARTNERSHIP WITH BUSINESS AND GOVERNMENT. CEDA OFFERS EDUCATION, ADVOCACY AND DIRECT SERVICES.
IRS990.Desc: ENERGY SERVICES ASSISTS ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS IN REDUCING HOME HEATING AND COOLING COSTS. A MONETARY BENEFIT TOWARDS ENERGY BILLS IS PROVIDED ON BEHALF OF THE APPLICANT. COUNSELING, OUTREACH, INFORMATION AND REFERRALS TO OTHER ENERGY RELATED PROGRAMS ARE ALSO PROVIDED.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ENERGY CONSERVATION OFFERS WEATHERIZATION AND REHABILITATION TO ELIGIBLE, LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS. THE PROCESS ENTAILS ASSESSING THE HOME, EVALUATING ITS ENERGY EFFICIENCY THROUGH SOPHISTICATED TESTING, AND THEN DEVELOPING A WORK ORDER TO CORRECT DEFICIENCIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: HEALTH AND NUTRITION: SEVERAL PROGRAMS THAT AIM TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH STATUES OF HIGH RISK WOMEN, INFANTS AND CHILDREN BY PROVIDING NUTRITION EDUCATION, COMPREHENSIVE AND INTENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES TO YOUNG TEEN PARENTS AND THEIR CHILDREN; ENSURE THAT THE TEEN PARENT OBTAINS HIS/HER HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA AND ASSIST FAMILIES TO HELP THEMSELVES BECOME MORE SELF-SUFFICIENT, COMPETENT AND FEEL EMPOWERED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION OF COOK COUNTY, INC. (CEDA) HAS MADE AN ELECTION UNDER IRC SECTION 501(H) TO CALCULATE THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF LOBBYING EXPENSES DURING THE FISCAL YEAR. CEDA DID NOT HAVE ANY LOBBYING EXPENSES DURING THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR BUT IS REQUIRED TO FILE SCHEDULE C DUE TO THE IRC SECTION 501(H) ELECTION.

CEDA IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IN ADDITION, CEDA QUALIFIES FOR THE CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION DEDUCTION UNDER SECTION 170(B)(1)(A) AND HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT PRIVATE FOUNDATION. CEDA IS REQUIRED TO ASSESS WHETHER IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT A TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION ASSUMING THE TAXING AUTHORITY HAS FULL KNOWLEDGE OF ALL INFORMATION. IF THE TAX POSITION DOES NOT MEET THE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT RECOGNITION THRESHOLD, THE BENEFIT OF THAT POSITION IS NOT RECOGTNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. CEDA HAS DETERMINED THERE ARE NOT AMOUNTS TO RECORD AS ASSETS OR LIABILITIES RELTED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

CEDA'S SELECTION CRITERIA FOR GRANT OR OTHER ASSISTANCE IS DICTATED BY GRANT AWARD DOCUMENTS. THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF ASSISTANCE VARIES DEPENDING ON THE TYPE OF ASSISTANCE REQUESTED. PROGRAM SPECIALISTS REVIEW EACH GRANT APPLICATION AND DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF GRANT OR OTHER ASSISTANCE TO WHICH THE GRANTEE QUALIFIES. CEDA MAKES GRANT PAYMENTS DIRECTLY TO VENDORS WHO PROVIDE DIRECT ASSISTANCE TO THE GRANTEE.
THE AGENCY PAID PERFORMANCE BONUSES TO LEADERSHIP STAFF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED AND REVIEWED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX PREPARERS AND MANAGEMENT. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL GOVERNING BODY FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CEDA HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY STATEMENT THAT IS INCLUDED IN THE BYLAWS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE PROCUREMENT MANUAL, AND THE ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND PROCEDURAL MANUAL. CEDA'S PROCEDURES REQUIRE ATTESTATION BY EACH OFFICER, DIRECTOR AND KEY EMPLOYEE THAT THEY HAVE NO CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THIS IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY, DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED ON A REGULAR BASIS. SHOULD A CONFLICT ARISE, THE BOARD MEMBER INVOLVED WOULD BE PROHIBITED FROM PARTICIPATING IN THE GOVERNING BODY'S DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS IN THIS TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO COMPENSATION WAS CONFIRMED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THIS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES. A THIRDPARTY FIRM PROVIDED SALARY INFORMATION TO ASSIST THE BOARD WITH THE DECISION. THE CEO ESTABLISHES THE SALARY OF THE OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZING SALARY DATA OBTAINED FROM AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES THE FORM 990 AVAILABLE BY REQUEST AND ALSO INFORMS THE PUBLIC THAT IT IS AVAILABLE ON GUIDESTAR'S WEBSITE. THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS ITS OWN WEBSITE TO INFORM THE PUBLIC ABOUT ITS ORGANIZATION AND PROGRAMS AND OTHER ACTIVITIES. IF ANY INFORMATION ABOUT THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS OR THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY OF THE ORGANIZATION IS NEEDED THEN THE PUBLIC IS ENCOURAGED TO OBTAIN IT FROM THE ORGANIZATION UPON REQUEST.
THE AUDIT SELECTION PROCESS DID NOT CHANGE FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
